name: Requestly
headline: Open-Source Postman alternative
description: Requestly helps developers build faster by intercepting, mocking, and testing API responses. No more waiting for backend developers, struggling with flaky staging environments, or fighting over API contracts. With 200,000+ active installs, Requestly is trusted by Google, Amazon, Workday, Indeed, and many other Fortune 500 companies.

founders.name: Sachin Jain, Founder
founders.description: Sachin is the co-founder & CEO, Requestly. Sachin plays a leading role in defining the vision of the company, the product direction, talking to existing & potential customers. He has over 10 years of industry experience and has worked with Google, Adobe & Grofers in the past. He built many side projects & participated in many hackathons. Requestly was also started as a side-project on which he worked tirelessly for the sake of love of the product eventually making it into it full-time.

founders.name: Sagar Soni, Founder
founders.description:
I'm the co-founder and CTO of Requestly, a developer tools platform serving 200,000+ developers globally. We're backed by Y Combinator and Sequoia Capital SEA.
Previously, I founded College-Adviser, bootstrapping it to $12K ARR with 500K+ monthly visitors in its first year. I started coding at 11 and have since built multiple software projects.

API Testing & Mocking
##  Supercharge your workflow for 10x faster development
Enable developers & QAs to build and test independently with easy API mocking, API Testing, environment switching, and API modification for faster, more flexible development. Simplify debugging and accelerate feature delivery without dependence on other teams.
[ Docs ](https://requestly.com/<https:/docs.requestly.com/general/getting-started/introduction>) [ Schedule a demo call -> ](https://requestly.com/<https:/calendly.com/requestly/sagar>)
![Requestly security and compliance](https://requestly.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Product-Insert-script-3.png)
[ API Mocking Instantly mock API responses and response status codes without touching the backend or your frontend code. Simulate edge cases with logic based mocks. ![API Mocking](https://requestly.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Home-modify-api-response.png) ](https://requestly.com/<https:/requestly.com/products/mock-server/>)
[ API Testing Quickly test API responses with a simple and powerful API Client. Loaded with all the features like API Collections, Environment variables, etc. ![API Testing](https://requestly.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Home-API-testing.png) ](https://requestly.com/<https:/requestly.com/products/api-client/>)
[ Intercept HTTPS Traffic Intercept, Modify, and Mock HTTPS Traffic from browsers, desktop apps, and mobile apps. Seamlessly intercept Android/iOS simulators as well as physical devices. ![Intercept HTTPS Traffic](https://requestly.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/12/Home-HTTP-traffic.png) ](https://requestly.com/<https:/docs.requestly.com/general/http-interceptor/overview>)
Mock Server
##  Create 100s of Mocks in Seconds
Record a live HTTP session and use it to create 100s of API Mocks with 1-Click.
[ Learn more ](https://requestly.com/<https:/requestly.com/blog/develop-with-confidence-by-recording-and-mocking-flaky-apis-using-requestly/>)
Your browser does not support the video tag.
Filter and create API Mocks with 1 Click.
Mock a whole backend service by simply recording an API calls sessions and create bulk mocks with 1 click.
Mocks run locally and can be shared with team.
API Mocks run locally by overriding your actual API calls and can be easily shared with your team.
Supports both REST & GraphQL APIs
API mocks supports REST & GraphQL APIs enabling your to work with wide range of APIs.
“Great tool for frontend developers and QA tester for API response, redirects, mock data and much more. Requestly removes the dependency on waiting for backend API’s.”
![Samroon Michael](https://requestly.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/04/Samroon-Michael-1-jpeg.webp)
Samroon Michael
Senior Frontend Developer at **Mudah.my**
HTTP Rules
##  Manage API Behaviour using HTTP Rules
Intercept and modify HTTP Requests using easy-to-configure rules. Modify any part of the request like URL, query params, header, request body, response body, response statuses & response headers.
[ Learn more ](https://requestly.com/<https:/requestly.com/products/http-interceptor/>)
Your browser does not support the video tag.
Make cross-environment API calls.
Test your local APIs with staging frontend or vice-versa using Redirect & Replace Rules.
Simulate edge cases easily.
Modify the request, response or headers of API calls to simulate edge cases with ease.
Insert custom scripts on any webpage.
Test your JS or CSS on production websites before shipping to ensure they work as expected.
“Requestly is an incredibly useful tool! The Sessions feature is especially useful for documenting solutions or sharing with others since it captures the relevant network traffic, and screen recording enables others to easily reproduce.”
![Joél Hawkins Torres](https://requestly.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Joel-Hawkins-Torres-jpeg.avif)
Joél Hawkins Torres
Senior Software Engineer at **AutoDesk**
Mobile Interception
##  Develop Mobile/Desktop Apps faster
Due to the lack of network monitoring capabilities of major mobile/desktop app environments like iOS, Swift, Android, Electron, Flutter, Windows Desktop App, & React Native, etc. its hard to work with APIs, Requestly makes it easy by allowing you to watch and fiddle with those network requests.
[ iOS Devs ](https://requestly.com/<https:/requestly.com/lp/simplify-your-ios-development/>) [ Android Devs → ](https://requestly.com/<https:/requestly.com/lp/android-interception/>)
Your browser does not support the video tag.
Capture and Modify HTTPS traffic from iOS Apps
Capture, Record, Bulk Mock and Modify HTTP(S) traffic from any iOS app running on Emulator or iPhone without any code changes for faster development.
Intercept your Android Apps' traffic
Intercept, Mock and Modify HTTP(S) traffic from your Android apps running on Emulator or Android Phones with ease.
“Requestly is an incredibly useful tool! The Sessions feature is especially useful for documenting solutions or sharing with others since it captures the relevant network traffic, and screen recording enables others to easily reproduce.”

Built for teams
##  Effortless team collaboration
Share instantly, sync effortlessly, and collaborate effectively with your team in dedicated workspaces.
[ Learn more -> ](https://requestly.com/<https:/requestly.com/blog/how-requestly-can-improve-team-collaboration-using-workspaces/>)
Your browser does not support the video tag.
Quick One time sharing
Instantly generate a link for your assets, such as rules, mocks, and recordings, and share it with your team in one click.
Team workspaces
Easily collaborate with teammates in a shared workspace. Group assets, such as mocks, rules, and sessions, in one place.
Export data & sync to Git
Developers utilize session data directly in pull requests.
Secure and private
##  Enterprise-ready security and compliance
Requestly ensures top-tier security with SOC-II compliance, SSO integration, and role-based access control. We protect your data and secure your workflows, making us the ideal choice for enterprises.
[ Learn more ](https://requestly.com/</blog/announcing-requestly-soc-2-type-ii-compliance-certification/>) [ Schedule a demo call -> ](https://requestly.com/<https:/calendly.com/requestly/sagar>)
![Requestly security and compliance](https://requestly.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/09/soc2-badge.webp)
SOC-II Compliance
Adheres to rigorous security standards for data protection and privacy.
Single Sign-On (SSO)
Simplifies user access with secure, centralized authentication.
Role-based access control
Ensures precise control over user permissions and data access.
Data encryption
Protects your data in transit and at rest with advanced encryption protocols.
Audit logs
Protects your data in transit and at rest with advanced encryption protocols.
Regular security updates
Keeps your environment secure with timely updates and patches.

generated_description:
**Requestly: An Open-Source Alternative for API Development**

Founded in 2021 and a part of Y Combinator's W22 batch, Requestly is carving out its niche as an open-source alternative to Postman. The company, based in San Francisco, set out on a mission to help developers accelerate their workflow by intercepting, mocking, and testing API responses. It's a lifesaver for developers who are tired of waiting on backend teams or wrestling with unstable staging environments. With over 200,000 active installations, Requestly has gained the trust of industry giants like Google, Amazon, Workday, and Indeed.

### Key Features & Offerings:

1. **HTTP Interceptor**: Modify and inject HTTP requests and responses in real time. This means developers can tweak API requests as needed without any backend changes.
   
2. **Mock API Server**: Easily create mock servers for API responses, which helps teams build and test without waiting for backend development. 

3. **API Client**: A lightweight tool designed for testing APIs that's perfect for quick setups and team collaborations.

4. **SessionBook**: A comprehensive tool that captures, reports, and debugs errors with session replay capabilities, allowing developers to easily trace issues.

5. **Cross-Device Testing**: Users can inspect and manipulate HTTP traffic across Android and iOS simulators, which is invaluable for testing mobile applications.

6. **GraphQL Support**: More targeted API modifications are possible with specific support for GraphQL endpoints, making it an even more robust tool for modern developers.

### Security and Compliance

Requestly recently achieved SOC 2 compliance, ensuring that it meets stringent security standards. They prioritize data privacy and security, which is crucial for organizations handling sensitive information.

### Team and Vision

With a team of just 19, Requestly is a lean operation focused on delivering powerful developer tools. Their straightforward approach and dedication to open-source principles resonate well with a community eager for effective tech solutions.

### Why Use Requestly?

For developers, especially frontend engineers and QA professionals, Requestly provides the flexibility to build and test independently. In a landscape where speed and efficiency are paramount, this tool empowers teams, removes bottlenecks, and enhances collaboration.

In summary, Requestly isn’t just another tool; it represents a shift toward more independent, agile development practices. If you’re in tech and find yourself waiting too long for backend support, it might just be the missing piece in your developer toolbox. Check it out at their [website](https://requestly.com)!
